{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3548723,"name":"","username":"StarManTheGamer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a698b9/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T22:44:07.184Z","cooked":"

Hi there,

Our team is using tank drive this year for our robot, and I wanted to try a new approach with our autonomous. In the previous years, we’ve hardcoded a timer in our programming and just told the motors what speed to go to - It’s not very efficient and has never worked at actual competition because our projections are always off. I wanted to give PathPlanner a shot, but I’m not very familiar with it. I know it’s mostly used for swerve, and that’s what the default configuration is set for. Does anyone know how I can try and use PathPlanner with Tank Drive?

Thanks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T22:44:07.184Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":22,"reads":94,"readers_count":93,"score":128.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494409,"topic_slug":"using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive/494409/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548773,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T23:45:04.874Z","cooked":"

We followed the PP documentation for building autos and paths. Some work and some don’t. We’ve had to run them slowly to get accuracy. We are still working on one more issue and maybe tonight we’ll know if we can speed up the paths.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T23:45:04.874Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494409,"topic_slug":"using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive/494409/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548780,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-05T23:58:32.275Z","cooked":"

PathPlanner is, of course, mostly used with holonomic drivetrains, but you can use a tank drive without issue by unselecting the holonomic checkbox in the app settings. I don’t know exactly where it is because the app layout changed since last season.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-05T23:58:32.275Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":12.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494409,"topic_slug":"using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive/494409/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548796,"name":"Jacob Schnitzlein ","username":"jSchnitz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jschnitz/{size}/7459_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T00:33:10.515Z","cooked":"

We used Pathplanner with tank drive last year. Like was mentioned above, it worked well for us at low speed but got unstable at moderate to high speed. I assume it was a tuning problem.

It did get better after recharacterizing our drivetrain with a kA term. We also found that the LTV controller worked better for us than Ramsete. We never did get it working well at high speed even with those improvements. In this match, the closest red robot is a good example of the instability we saw. The portion at the beginning was the fastest we could go without the instability.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T00:33:10.515Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":49,"readers_count":48,"score":14.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494409,"topic_slug":"using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive","display_username":"Jacob Schnitzlein ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.thebluealliance.com/match/2024incol_sf4m1","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Match 4 - FIN District Columbus Event 2024 - The Blue Alliance","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22721,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3147 Mentor / 1986 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive/494409/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548810,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T00:59:39.558Z","cooked":"

PathPlanner autos also work better with Velocity PID, were you using that?

Combining SysID characterization + feedforward + PIDVS + LTVUnicycle will get you good results. Also ensure your max accel isn’t too high and that your robot itself has a low CoG.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T00:59:39.558Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":38,"readers_count":37,"score":12.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494409,"topic_slug":"using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":22721,"username":"jSchnitz","name":"Jacob Schnitzlein ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jschnitz/{size}/7459_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive/494409/5","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548825,"name":"Jacob Schnitzlein ","username":"jSchnitz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jschnitz/{size}/7459_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T01:20:09.615Z","cooked":"

Definitely all great advice, we did run velocity PID + FF, tuned manually and refined with SysID, for each side of the drive. CG wasn’t ideal and we were definitely trying to push the limits of acceleration to get those center notes.

This was only last year - the team has swerve this year and it’s night and day on the ease of path following. As an off-season project I might encourage the team to dust off the 2024 bot and give tuning it for high speed path following another shot.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T01:20:09.615Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":32,"readers_count":31,"score":26.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494409,"topic_slug":"using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive","display_username":"Jacob Schnitzlein ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50684,"username":"crueter","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22721,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3147 Mentor / 1986 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/using-pathplanner-with-tank-drive/494409/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3548859,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T01:46:29.299Z","cooked":"

Yeah that just sounds like a CG issue then. It’s just as if not MORE important for swerve bots, but teams that are limited to tank generally don’t have the resources necessary to get a super bottom-heavy robot.
